title: Go Compiler nil Pointer Checks
description:
Introduction
I was thinking about how the compiler looks to protect the code we write when it can. Invalid memory access checks are one type of safety check the compiler adds to our code. We might think that this "extra code" is hurting our performance and maybe over billions of iterative operations it is. However, these checks can prevent our code from causing damage to the systems we are running on.

title: Parse An XML Response With PHP
description:
If you’re like me, you find XML a real pain to deal with, but yet it still seems to exist with various web services. If you’re using Android or AngularJS, these frameworks can’t process XML out of the box, but they can JSON.

With the assistance of a PHP powered web server, you can easily transform the nasty XML responses you get into something more usable like JSON.

The post Parse An XML Response With PHP appeared first on The Polyglot Developer.
